title: Multi-byte characters in Server Action inputs can get mangled when using the Edge Runtime

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue was opened via the bug report template.

labels.name: Runtime
labels.description: Related to Node.js or Edge Runtime with Next.js.

body:
### Link to the code that reproduces this issue

https://github.com/vexcat/mojibake-example

### To Reproduce

1. Start the application in development
2. Observe that the called server action, rather than returning its input as-is, intersperses many ï¿½ characters in its output.

### Current vs. Expected behavior

I expect the server action to receive the UTF-8 text intact, but it becomes mangled.

### Provide environment information

```bash
Operating System:
  Platform: darwin
  Arch: arm64
  Version: Darwin Kernel Version 24.2.0: Tue Oct 15 18:17:45 PDT 2024; root:xnu-11215.60.364.501.5~3/RELEASE_ARM64_T6030
  Available memory (MB): 18432
  Available CPU cores: 11
Binaries:
  Node: 20.15.0
  npm: 10.7.0
  Yarn: 1.22.22
  pnpm: N/A
Relevant Packages:
  next: 15.2.0-canary.8 // Latest available version is detected (15.2.0-canary.8).
  eslint-config-next: N/A
  react: 19.0.0
  react-dom: 19.0.0
  typescript: 5.7.3
Next.js Config:
  output: N/A
```

### Which area(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

Runtime

### Which stage(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

Other (Deployed), next start (local), next build (local), next dev (local)

### Additional context

I've traced the bug down to [this portion of action-handler.ts](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/blob/v15.2.0-canary.8/packages/next/src/server/app-render/action-handler.ts#L715):

```js
const reader = req.body.getReader()
while (true) {
  const { done, value } = await reader.read()
  if (done) {
    break
  }

  actionData += new TextDecoder().decode(value)
}
```

`TextDecoder` is incorrectly used to decode each chunk, rather than decode all chunks concatenated.

This only affects the edge runtime, because the text decoding is done properly in the non-edge-runtime branch of this function.

```js
const chunks: Buffer[] = []
for await (const chunk of req.body) {
  chunks.push(Buffer.from(chunk))
}

const actionData = Buffer.concat(chunks).toString('utf-8')
```

I'm not sure if "Runtime" is the best category for this bug, please go ahead and change if this is not accurate. I will submit a PR to fix this issue soon.
